messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Kent Beck

> The existence of the Composite pattern in the
> Test/TestCase/TestSuite troika caused us problems. It was
> difficult to explain and it made writing test runners more
> difficult. One particularly vexing problem was re-running
> single tests while making sure all the TestDecorators and
> TestSuite subclasses higher in the test tree were run
> correctly.

I'm not sure I see the problem? TestNG does that and can even calculate
dependencies to make sure that dependent methods are run before the method
you really want to run is executed.

The framework should only see a list of methods to call, that's true, but
letting users specify hierarchies of tests can be handy.
